title: Police investigating after piece of a pig turns up in Newton park
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A pig leg or flank was found near Flowed Meadow at the Cove in Newton's Auburndale Park.
Newton Police, Animal Control, and Mass. Environmental Police are investigating the incident involving the left pig meat.
Hunting or feeding wildlife in Newton parks is prohibited under Massachusetts General Law, Chapter 131, Section 59.

title: Jaylen Brown, Payton Pritchard dominate in blowout win over Lakers: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 10-for-28 shooting and contributed defensively with three steals against the Lakers.
Payton Pritchard scored 30 points off the bench, leading the Celtics to a 111-89 victory over the Lakers.
The Celtics rotated Neemias Queta and Nikola Vucevic at center, with Queta playing 25 minutes to Vucevic's 20.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Dozens of Massachusetts school districts announce closures for Feb. 23 due to a major snowstorm.
School districts closed include Abington, Acton-Boxborough, Arlington, Bedford, Bellingham, Boston, and many more.
The nor'easter is causing widespread school closures and is expected to impact the region significantly.

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kyron Simmons, 36, wanted for shooting and killing a dog at Sunset Hill Housing Development, Fall River, in early February.
Simmons faces charges including home invasion, discharging a firearm, animal cruelty, and reckless child endangerment.
Police confirmed Simmons as the suspect using security footage and evidence; he's considered armed and dangerous.

title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Bobcat sighting reported near Deerpath Road and Route 109 in Dedham, a town with a known bobcat population.
Dedham Animal Control advises residents on safe coexistence with wildlife, including eliminating outdoor food sources and sealing crawl spaces.
Residents encouraged to report sick, injured, or aggressive animals to local animal control authorities.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Cora shares potential 2026 Red Sox lineup with Roman Anthony and Trevor Story leading off.
Roman Anthony returns as leadoff after a strong 2025 performance; Trevor Story follows as No. 2 hitter.
Marcelo Mayer, despite being a top prospect, may not start on Opening Day due to performance expectations.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Meteorologists predict up to 2 feet of snow and high winds, potentially causing power outages and affecting travel in Massachusetts.
Boston declared a snow emergency; city buildings and schools closed Monday, with parking bans effective on major roads.
MBTA operating on reduced storm schedules; DoorDash and Grubhub suspend Boston delivery services due to severe weather.

title: Bruins react to McAvoy, Swayman’s gold-medal win over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman helped Team USA win its first Olympic gold in men's hockey in 46 years.
McAvoy recorded the second-highest ice time on Team USA, playing a pivotal role in the tournament.
Jeremy Swayman made one start, allowing three goals in Team USA's win over Denmark during the group stage.

title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots hold the No. 31 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft, with experts suggesting focus on linemen or edge rushers.
Draft expert Daniel Jeremiah projects Missouri's Zion Young as a fit for New England's defensive needs at edge rusher.
Yahoo Sports suggests Oregon's Kenyon Sadiq for the Patriots due to his pass-catching and blocking abilities as a tight end.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey team won its first Olympic gold medal since 1980, defeating Canada 2-1 in Milan.
Jack Hughes scored the game-winning goal in overtime, while Connor Hellebuyck stopped 41 shots for Team USA.
The U.S. team aimed to replicate their historic 1960 and 1980 victories with a roster of NHL superstars.
